unnormalised: **Telecommunications: Fiber-to-Home Expansion Gains Traction in India**
normalised: **Telecommunications: Fiber-to-Home Expansion Gains Traction in India**

unnormalised: New Delhi – The ambitious BharatNet project is witnessing accelerated fiber-to-home (FTTH) deployment across rural India, according to a Ministry of Communications press release issued today. This initiative aims to connect over 2.5 lakh Gram Panchayats by providing high-speed internet access.
normalised: New Delhi – The ambitious BharatNet project is witnessing accelerated fiber-to-home (F T T H) deployment across rural India, according to a Ministry of Communications press release issued today. This initiative aims to connect over two point five lakh Gram Panchayats by providing high-speed internet access.

unnormalised: Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel continue to lead private sector investments in FTTH infrastructure, particularly in Tier-II and Tier-III cities. Recent reports indicate a surge in subscriptions, driven by the increasing demand for bandwidth-intensive applications like online education and entertainment.
normalised: Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel continue to lead private sector investments in F T T H infrastructure, particularly in Tier-Two and Tier-Three cities. Recent reports indicate a surge in subscriptions, driven by the increasing demand for bandwidth-intensive applications like online education and entertainment.

unnormalised: “We are committed to bridging the digital divide,” stated Shri. Ravi Shankar Prasad, Minister of Communications, during a press conference held on 26/01/2024. The project aims to provide affordable internet access at speeds up to 100 Mbps.
normalised: “We are committed to bridging the digital divide,” stated Shri. Ravi Shankar Prasad, Minister of Communications, during a press conference held on twenty sixth january two thousand and twenty four. The project aims to provide affordable internet access at speeds up to one hundred Megabits per second.

unnormalised: The Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI) is scheduled to release a consultation paper on revised FTTH tariffs by 15/03/2024 at 11:00 hrs, to ensure fair pricing. State-owned BSNL is also ramping up its FTTH services, focusing on areas underserved by private players. The total investment in FTTH infrastructure is projected to reach Rs. 50,000 crore by the end of financial year 2025. Over 10,000 km of optical fiber cable were laid in Uttar Pradesh alone last quarter. This expansion is expected to boost economic activity and empower rural communities across India.
normalised: The Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (T R A I) is scheduled to release a consultation paper on revised F T T H tariffs by fifteenth march two thousand and twenty four at eleven zero zero hours, to ensure fair pricing. State-owned B S N L is also ramping up its F T T H services, focusing on areas underserved by private players. The total investment in F T T H infrastructure is projected to reach rupee fifty thousand crore by the end of financial year two thousand and twenty five. Over ten thousand kilometer of optical fiber cable were laid in Uttar Pradesh alone last quarter. This expansion is expected to boost economic activity and empower rural communities across India.
